learning_objective: Observe intellectual property rights and give appropriate attribution when creating or remixing programs.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on an inventory management system for a local store. They want to add a feature to their program that was inspired by an open-source project they saw online. The code snippet that Alex wrote to calculate the restock quantity for an item is as follows:What steps should Alex take next to observe intellectual property rights and give appropriate attribution?",
    "Answer1": "Alex should cite the original source in the documentation, comments or program metadata.",
    "Answer2": "Alex should replace the code with their own completely different solution to avoid copyright issues.",
    "Answer3": "Alex should keep the code as is, no attribution is necessary since the code was written by them.",
    "Answer4": "Alex should simply add the logo of the open-source project to his program’s user interface.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "Simply rewriting code does not negate the need for attribution. Alex should include clear citations in the documentation, comments, or program metadata, and should adhere to any licensing requirements of the open-source project.",
    "code_snippet": "action calculateRestock(integer currentInventory, integer desiredInventory)\n    if currentInventory < desiredInventory\n        integer restock = desiredInventory - currentInventory\n        output \"Restock quantity for the item is: \" + restock \n    else\n        output \"No restock needed.\"\n    end\nend"
}
